jdrasil.algorithms.upperbounds

Class MaximumCardinalitySearchDecomposer<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdrasil.algorithms.upperbounds.MaximumCardinalitySearchDecomposer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.Callable<TreeDecomposition<T>>, TreeDecomposer<T>

    public class MaximumCardinalitySearchDecomposer<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeDecomposer<T>, java.io.Serializable
    This class implements the Maximum-Cardinality Search heuristic. The heuristic order the vertices of G from 1 to n in the following ordering: We first put a random vertex v at position n. Then we choose the vertex v' with the most neighbors that are already placed at position n-1 and recurse this way. Ties are broken randomly.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      MaximumCardinalitySearchDecomposer(Graph<T> graph)
      The algorithm is initialized with a graph that should be decomposed and a seed for randomness.

      • getCurrentSolution

        public TreeDecomposition<T> getCurrentSolution()
        Description copied from interface: TreeDecomposer
        This method returns the best solution found so far. This method should return null if @see call() was not called, or the algorithm does not found a solution yet, or if the algorithm is not anytime.
